required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of VBY-891 in Healthy Volunteers After Single or Multiple (7 Days) of Oral Dosing (VBY891P1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Sequential, Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Oral Doses of VBY-891 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Psoriasis is an inflammatory autoimmune disease that might be controlled by a cathepsin S inhibitor like VBY-891.

primary_outcome.time_frame: For 7 days (single dose) or 17 days (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Compare number of adverse events experienced by male versus female subjects

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of VBY-891 levels in blood after single or multiple doses

other_outcome.measure: Iip10 Accumulation and Cathepsin S Protein Level
other_outcome.description: Iip10 accumulation and cathepsin S protein level by Mass Spectrophotometry to determine inhibition of cathepsin S activity

arm_group.description: Capsules containing excipient but no active drug
